title: The Masterpiece of the Month: Portrait of George Washington, by Edward Savage, gift of Catherine Colvin
description: During February 1940, a 1793 portrait of George Washington by painter and engraver Edward Savage was featured as Masterpiece of the Month. As described by the newsletter announcing its exhibition, Savage presents the first U.S. president “in three-quarter length, wearing a black velvet costume and seated in a damask covered chair. At the right of the pillar, partially covered by a draped figured damask curtain. On the table are a cocked hat and map of the city of Washington.”

input: The Masterpiece of the Month: Portrait of George Washington, by Edward Savage, gift of Catherine Colvin
